title: TypeEmitter: enum abstract -> literal union types (TS mode)
description:
Improve `TypeEmitter` for TS mode to avoid emitting plain `string` / `number` for `@:enum abstract` types (especially String-based JS/DOM enums).

- Emit TS literal union types when values are known (e.g. `"default" | "no-store"`).
- Keep classic JS mode unchanged unless explicitly enabled.
- Update snapshots.
- Ensure `yarn test:ci` is green.
close_reason: Enum abstract TS unions via signature cache + snapshots; yarn test:ci green

title: genes-ts: macro-based TSX/JSX import helper
description: Implement macro-based import helper (default/named/namespace) backed by Genes dependency system (`:jsRequire`) to support importing npm packages and local TSX/JSX files. Add tests for JS + TS/TSX harness and update docs.
acceptance_criteria:
- Haxe API: default + named + namespace import macros
- Works for npm package imports and relative ./ imports
- Generates correct ESM imports in both JS and TS output modes
- No new untyped/Dynamic in harness/tests
- CI scripts: npm test + genes-ts harness stay green

title: genes-ts: improve generated TS typing (no any/stringly)
description: Bring genes-ts TypeScript output up to idiomatic, strongly-typed TS: minimize any/unknown, replace stringly stdlib shapes with TS builtins, and confine unavoidable escapes to a documented runtime boundary with justification comments. See docs/typescript-target/TYPING_POLICY.md.

title: Policy: runtime-only any/unknown + justification comments
description: Update AGENTS.md and add a check in the TS harness to ensure any/unknown does not appear in generated user modules. Allow a small runtime boundary (genes/*) but require justification comments for any/unknown usage there.

title: Type mapping: eliminate stringly/any stdlib shapes
description: Improve TS type mapping so generated output uses TS builtins where possible (e.g. PromiseSettledResult, PropertyDescriptor). Fix Null<T> mapping (no more any). Remove unnecessary generic defaults that introduce any.

title: Emitter: typed constructors + remove any from user modules
description: Change TsModuleEmitter to emit real typed constructors (no overload+...any[]), type the internal [Register.new] initializer parameters, and type reflection helpers (__name__/__class__/__super__/__interfaces__) without any in user code.

title: Emitter/runtime: remove prototype null-as-any seeding
description: Stop emitting prototype field seeding via null-as-any (example: Foo.prototype.x = null as any) and other user-module casts. Replace with a runtime helper (e.g. Register.seedFields / Object.defineProperty) or an alternative reflection strategy so output stays typed but Genes reflection continues to work.

title: Docs: add strictNullChecks profile templates
description: Add documented tsconfig templates for TS-strict (default strictNullChecks true) and Haxe-null-tolerant (strictNullChecks false) to examples and docs.

title: genes-ts: v1.0 hardening
description: Track remaining work to call genes-ts a stable 1.0: typed/idiomatic TS output, strong interop story, and a robust test harness (snapshots + todoapp Playwright) that keeps classic Genes green.

title: Typing: audit and reduce any/unknown in generated TS
description: Audit current generated TS (tests + todoapp dist-ts) for `any`/`unknown`/stringly types where better TS types exist. Implement the first batch of improvements (starting with stdlib hot spots like iterators and exceptions) while preserving Haxe semantics.
acceptance_criteria:
- Produce a short audit report (paths + categories)
- Land at least one concrete typing improvement with updated snapshots/dist-ts
- `yarn test:ci` passes

comments.author: Marcelo Serpa
comments.text: Landed first typing tightening: js.lib.IteratorStep<T> now maps to TS IteratorResult<T, undefined> (no any) and fixed anonymous object type field separators to avoid trailing whitespace. Added docs/typescript-target/TYPING_AUDIT.md. Verified: yarn test:ci passes.

title: Todoapp E2E: make Playwright test non-flaky
description: Harden the todoapp Playwright test so it is stable under CI load/latency (no timing flake). Prefer explicit waits/polling that are tied to observable UI/API state.
acceptance_criteria:
- `yarn test:todoapp:e2e` passes reliably
- `yarn test:ci` passes
- Document any new waiting helpers briefly

comments.author: Marcelo Serpa
comments.text:
Fix: avoid flake by waiting for list item count after clicking Add.
Verified: `yarn test:todoapp:e2e` passed 3 consecutive runs; `yarn test:ci` passes.

title: Typing: give DOM iterators real TS element types
description: Replace next(): Dynamic-style WebIDL iterators (e.g. js.html.HeadersIterator) with idiomatic TS iterator types (IterableIterator<...>) where we can provide accurate element types. This reduces any in generated TS and makes interop with DOM APIs feel native.
acceptance_criteria:
- examples/todoapp/**/dist-ts/src-gen no longer emits next: () => any for HeadersIterator / URLSearchParamsIterator / FormDataIterator
- Snapshots (dist-ts) updated and committed
- yarn test:ci passes

comments.author: Marcelo Serpa
comments.text: Override DOM WebIDL iterators to idiomatic TS types: HeadersIterator / URLSearchParamsIterator -> IterableIterator<[string,string]>, FormDataIterator -> IterableIterator<[string, FormDataEntryValue]>. Updated todoapp dist-ts snapshots. Verified: yarn test:ci passes.

title: Typing: tighten haxe.Exception and ValueException payloads
description: Reduce any usage in generated TS for exception helpers by modeling native/value payloads more precisely (prefer unknown only if unavoidable; otherwise use structural/builtin TS types). Keep behavior faithful to Haxe and do not leak unsafe typing into user modules.
acceptance_criteria:
- Audit current exception-related any/unknown usage in examples/todoapp/**/dist-ts/src-gen/haxe
- Land at least one concrete tightening without breaking tests
- yarn test:ci passes

comments.author: Marcelo Serpa
comments.text: Tightened exception typing by mapping Haxe Any payloads to TS unknown for haxe.Exception/haxe.ValueException signatures (native/value/constructor args and thrown/get_native). Updated snapshots and todoapp dist-ts. Verified: yarn test:ci passes.

title: Roadmap docs: update plan with v1.0 milestones + ts2hx experiment
description: Update HAXE_TO_TYPESCRIPT_COMPILER_PLAN.md to reflect the current repo reality (CI, security, tests, todoapp example, output dirs) and capture learnings about a future TS->Haxe transpiler (ts2hx) using the TypeScript compiler API (Program + TypeChecker). Add this as a low-priority future milestone without mixing Elixir work into v1.0.
acceptance_criteria:
- HAXE_TO_TYPESCRIPT_COMPILER_PLAN.md updated with current status + milestones
- Includes a future TS->Haxe (ts2hx) section (goals, architecture options, why TS Program+TypeChecker)
- No code changes required; docs-only is OK

title: Experiment: ts2hx (TypeScript/JS -> Haxe transpiler)
description: Low-priority experiment after genes-ts v1.0: transpile TypeScript to Haxe to enable easier porting of TS codebases to other targets. Likely implementation uses the TypeScript compiler API (Program + TypeChecker) to get resolved types and symbol info, then emits Haxe AST/text with extern-friendly boundaries. Consider writing this tool in TypeScript first (Node) to maximize reuse of TS typechecker.
acceptance_criteria:
- Documented prototype plan exists (inputs, supported TS subset, output style conventions)
- A minimal spike compiles 1-2 TS files to Haxe without runtime correctness claims
- Kept as separate tool/dir so it does not block genes-ts v1.0

title: TypeEmitter: support $0 placeholders in @:ts.type
description: Add support for placeholder substitution (e.g. $0, $1) inside @:ts.type/@:genes.type strings so generic wrappers can emit TS types with concrete type arguments (e.g. React state tuple).

title: docs: genes-ts v1.0 feature guide + recipes
description: Write/organize a v1.0-level README/docs guide covering: setup, flags (genes.ts, dynamic_unknown, minimal runtime, TSX modes), interop patterns (externs, @:ts.type placeholders), testing harness (todoapp + Playwright), and packaging (ts->js + d.ts).
close_reason: README + docs cover v1.0 features/flags, harness, packaging, security scan

title: genes-ts v1.0
description: Track remaining work to ship genes-ts v1.0 (typed TS output + idiomatic project structure + stable CI). This epic groups the next high-impact milestones.
close_reason: All v1.0 child tasks closed; CI gates green

title: genes-ts: TSX output modes (tsx + createElement low-level)
description:
Support two React output modes:

1) Idiomatic `.tsx` output (default)
2) Low-level `.ts` output that uses `React.createElement` for environments that don't want TSX

- Provide a compiler flag to select.
- Ensure typing remains strict and no explicit `any` leaks into user modules.
close_reason: TSX via .tsx output + low-level .ts createElement mode; covered by yarn test:genes-tsx/test:acceptance

title: Experiment: TS/JS → Haxe transpiler (ts2hx)
description: Low-priority post-1.0 experiment: build a TS/JS → Haxe source-to-source transpiler to help port existing TS/JS projects into Haxe (initially targeting JS via genes-ts, then enabling later manual refactors to port to other Haxe targets).
design: Canonical plan: docs/ts2hx/PLAN.md\n\nPositioning: post-1.0 migration tool (TS/JS → Haxe-for-JS first), not a full multi-target compiler. Use TS compiler API (Program + TypeChecker) for parsing + module resolution + symbols/TSX. See plan doc for rationale (including why TS is harder to transpile from vs Haxe).
acceptance_criteria:
- A short design doc describing scope + non-goals
- CLI can parse a small TS project (tsconfig) and emit compiling Haxe for a subset (imports/exports, functions, classes, interfaces/type aliases)
- Golden/snapshot fixtures for output stability
- Document the intended workflow + limitations

title: ts2hx M0: design doc + scope
description: Write the initial ts2hx design doc, define v0 supported subset + non-goals, and document why we must treat this as a migration tool (TS/JS → Haxe-for-JS first).
acceptance_criteria: - docs/ts2hx/PLAN.md exists and matches the intended scope\n- genes-av0 has child milestone issues
close_reason: Added docs/ts2hx/PLAN.md and created milestone issues under genes-av0.

title: ts2hx M1: scaffold tools/ts2hx
description: Add an isolated tool package under tools/ts2hx with a minimal CLI skeleton (argument parsing, reading tsconfig path, basic logging).
acceptance_criteria: - tools/ts2hx/ exists with package.json + build/run scripts\n- CLI runs (prints help/version)\n- No impact on main compiler tests
close_reason: Added tools/ts2hx scaffold with package.json + minimal CLI.

title: ts2hx M2: Program + module resolution
description: Implement tsconfig parsing and Program construction (TypeScript compiler API). Enumerate source files deterministically and collect module graph basics.
acceptance_criteria: - Can load a fixture tsconfig and list SourceFiles deterministically\n- TSX files parse successfully\n- Basic diagnostics surfaced
close_reason: Implemented tsconfig parsing + Program creation, deterministic file listing, TSX fixture, and optional diagnostics output.

title: ts2hx M3: minimal Haxe codegen subset
description: Emit compiling Haxe for a small but useful subset: imports/exports, functions, interfaces/type aliases (best-effort types with safe fallbacks).
acceptance_criteria: - A small fixture TS project transpiles to Haxe\n- Emitted Haxe compiles (JS target)\n- Snapshot output is deterministic
close_reason: Implemented minimal TS→Haxe emission (imports/exports, functions, type aliases, interfaces) with deterministic snapshots and a compiling fixture.

title: ts2hx M4: classes + enums
description: Add class emission (fields/methods/constructors/extends/implements) and best-effort enum emission.
acceptance_criteria: - Class fixtures compile and run on JS\n- Enum fixtures compile and typecheck
close_reason: Added TS→Haxe emission for exported classes and enums with fixtures + snapshots and a JS smoke run via generated Haxe.

title: ts2hx M5: snapshot + integration harness
description: Add golden/snapshot tests for emitted Haxe and a small number of integration compile+run checks.
acceptance_criteria: - Deterministic snapshots for curated fixtures\n- At least one fixture compiles via Haxe (JS) and runs a smoke test\n- Clear update workflow for snapshots
close_reason: Added deterministic snapshot + smoke harness (via tools/ts2hx test-snapshots) and documented update workflow.

title: Example: fullstack todoapp (Haxe→TS)
description: Create a fullstack Todo app example (frontend + backend) written in Haxe and compiled with genes-ts to TypeScript. Demonstrate React Router, extern interop, shared types between front/back, and an ergonomic build/dev workflow.
acceptance_criteria:
- examples/todoapp builds and runs
- Frontend uses React Router
- Backend exposes JSON API
- Shared types used across front/back
- Demonstrates extern usage and TS ecosystem interop
- Documented in README

title: Docs: explain TS vs Genes JS output modes
description: Update README + docs to clearly explain the two supported output modes: (1) genes-ts TypeScript source output (-D genes.ts), and (2) classic Genes JS ESM output (omit -D genes.ts) with optional -D dts. Include rationale, when to choose which, and the implications (TS compiler required vs not).
acceptance_criteria: - README and docs describe both output modes\n- Clear invocation examples for each\n- Notes on import specifier modes (.js vs extensionless)

title: Chore: update AGENTS.md for new dev workflow
description: Update AGENTS.md to reflect genes-ts conventions (two output modes, how to run tests/examples, how to use bd).
acceptance_criteria: - AGENTS.md mentions both output modes\n- AGENTS.md lists key commands for tests and examples

title: Example: todoapp backend (Node)
description: Implement backend for examples/todoapp as Haxe→TS output targeting Node. Provide a small JSON REST API for todos and a persistence strategy.
acceptance_criteria: - Server builds with genes-ts and runs in Node\n- CRUD endpoints for todos\n- Uses externs to consume a Node web framework or Node APIs

title: Example: todoapp frontend (React Router)
description: Implement frontend for examples/todoapp as Haxe→TSX output with React Router. Uses genes.react.JSX macro / inline markup.
acceptance_criteria: - Frontend builds and runs\n- Routes implemented with React Router\n- Demonstrates TSX output and typed intrinsics

title: Example: shared types + API client
description: Create shared Haxe types (Todo, API request/response) compiled to TS and used by both server and client. Provide a small typed API client.
acceptance_criteria: - Shared model types compiled once\n- Client and server both import shared generated TS\n- Demonstrates clean interop

title: CI: enforce typing-policy on todoapp generated todo modules
description: Extend scripts/test-acceptance or example build scripts to run typing-policy check against examples/todoapp/*/src-gen/todo (web, server, e2e) so CI enforces no explicit any/unknown in authored modules.

title: ts2hx: v1 full TS project coverage
description: Track the long-term goal for ts2hx to accept and transpile real-world TypeScript (incl TSX) projects into Haxe-for-JS with best-effort typing + explicit escape hatches. See docs/ts2hx/PLAN.md.

title: todoapp: replace deprecated __js__ with js.Syntax.code
description: Haxe warns that __js__ is deprecated in todoapp server/e2e harness. Replace uses of __js__ with js.Syntax.code (or equivalent) while keeping typing-policy intact (avoid Dynamic/untyped except justified boundaries).

title: genes-ts minimal runtime profile (opt-in)
description:
Add an opt-in minimal runtime profile (no-reflection / minimal Register features) for users who don't need Haxe-portability and want leaner output.

- Define a flag (e.g. `-D genes.ts.minimal_runtime`) and document tradeoffs.
- Keep default behavior unchanged.
- Add tests.
close_reason: Implemented -D genes.ts.minimal_runtime with harness + docs; covered by yarn test:acceptance

title: dts: remove WUnusedPattern warning in DefinitionEmitter
description: Fix the (WUnusedPattern) warning from src/genes/dts/DefinitionEmitter.hx:307-308 by removing or correcting the unused pattern match. Keep dts output unchanged and all tests green.

title: Interop: macro-based import helper for TS/JS/TSX
description:
Design + implement a macro-based helper to consume existing TS/JS/TSX/JSX modules ergonomically from Haxe (imports + extern generation patterns).

- Keep typed boundaries.
- Avoid `Dynamic` / `untyped` in user-facing helpers.
close_reason: genes.ts.Imports macro-based helper covers JS/TS/TSX/JSX interop; docs + tests in todoapp

title: genes-ts: Haxe → TypeScript compiler (Genes-based)
description:
Source of truth: HAXE_TO_TYPESCRIPT_COMPILER_PLAN.md

Goal: Build a fully-featured Haxe→TypeScript compiler on the latest stable Haxe 4.x toolchain (Haxe 4.3.7) by extending Genes' JS-platform custom generator approach.

Key defaults (locked):
- TS is primary output (idiomatic TS code + project structure)
- strict TS by default (configurable)
- default runtime compatibility + opt-in minimal-runtime mode
- default .js import specifiers + opt-in extensionless imports
- Dynamic→any by default + opt-in Dynamic→unknown
- TS metadata preferred (@:ts.type/@:ts.returnType) with Genes aliases

title: M0: Compiler contract + repo layout + TS config baselines
description:
Lock the exact compiler contract before implementation.

Deliverables:
- Decide output directories (e.g. src-gen/ + dist/)
- Define names for toggles (ts.no_extension, ts.dynamic_unknown, ts.minimal_runtime, etc.)
- Recommend default tsconfig profile (NodeNext baseline) + bundler profile
- Document how users invoke the target on Haxe 4.7 (likely still via -js <out>.ts)
- Document packaging workflow (ts source + dist build)
acceptance_criteria:
- Written contract doc (or plan update) naming defaults
- One example build.hxml + tsconfig.json drafted
- Clear define/metadata surface listed
notes: Delivered M0 contract + example configs: docs/typescript-target/COMPILER_CONTRACT.md and examples/typescript-target/{build.hxml,tsconfig.node-next.json,tsconfig.bundler.json}.

title: M9: Haxe 4.3.7 toolchain compatibility
description: Ensure genes-ts is pinned to the latest stable Haxe 4.x toolchain and that all harnesses still pass.\n\nNote: As of Jan 2026, the latest stable Haxe 4 release is 4.3.7; there is no official Haxe 4.7 stable release.
acceptance_criteria:
- .haxerc pinned to Haxe 4.3.7
- npm test passes
- npm run test:genes-ts:full passes
- npm run test:genes-ts:minimal passes

title: Release: genes-ts v1.0 cut
description:
Prepare a v1.0 release of genes-ts.

Scope:
- Decide published library name and invocation contract (e.g. keep -lib genes + -D genes.ts vs rename)
- Update readme.md + docs for end-users
- Ensure example project is runnable and documented
- Tag/release workflow (git tag + GitHub release)
acceptance_criteria:
- haxelib.json updated (name=genes-ts, version=1.0.0)
- readme.md updated with v1 contract + test commands
- docs/typescript-target/COMPILER_CONTRACT.md matches invocation contract
- examples/typescript-target runnable via npm run build:example:genes-ts
- Git tag v1.0.0 created and pushed

title: React HXX: type-safe TSX-like authoring in Haxe
description:
Add a React authoring DSL using an HXX-style macro so users can write TSX-like markup in Haxe and compile it with genes-ts.

Deliverables:
- `genes.react.JSX.jsx` (macro) that parses JSX-ish markup and generates React element expressions
- Output modes:
  - Default: emit `.tsx` and print TSX markup for React element expressions
  - Low-level: emit `.ts` and keep `React.createElement(...)` calls
- JSX runtime:
  - Default: TypeScript `jsx: "react-jsx"` (automatic runtime)
  - Opt-in classic runtime support
- Intrinsic elements are **always typed** (no Dynamic fallback), including `data-*` / `aria-*`
- Optional inline markup support (rewrite `@:markup` -> `JSX.jsx(...)`)
- Tests that compile under strict genes-ts harness and run with `react-dom/server`

Reference pattern: reflaxe.elixir HXX + InlineMarkup.
acceptance_criteria:
- React authoring macro: genes.react.JSX.jsx
- Optional inline markup rewrite: genes.react.InlineMarkup.enable() (gated by -D genes.react.inline_markup)
- TSX mode: emit .tsx + print TSX markup from JSX markers (default automatic runtime)
- Low-level mode: emit .ts + lower JSX markers into React.createElement calls
- Opt-in classic runtime: -D genes.ts.jsx_classic injects React import for TSX output
- Intrinsic elements typed per-tag incl. data-*/aria-*
- Tests: npm run test:genes-ts:tsx (strict + runtime via react-dom/server)

title: M1: TS emitter skeleton (modules + classes + tsc green)
description:
Create the minimal TS emitter that produces valid TS per module and type-checks.

Scope:
- Emit ESM imports/exports
- Emit export class declarations (not const-class expressions)
- Handle minimal expression set for hello-world style examples
- Wire up sourcemap scaffolding (Haxe→TS)

Out of scope:
- Full expression coverage
- Enums/abstracts edge cases
acceptance_criteria:
- Generated TS passes tsc --noEmit for a small fixture
- Node runtime sanity test passes after TS->JS compilation
- Output is deterministic
close_reason: M1 complete: TS emitter skeleton wired behind -D genes.ts; strict tsc + runtime harness green (npm test, npm run test:genes-ts).

title: M2: Expression coverage parity (Genes ExprEmitter → TS)
description:
Port/adapt Genes expression emission to TS output while maintaining JS semantics.

Notes:
- Preserve cycle/extends strategy (Register.inherits)
- Preserve closure binding strategy (Register.bind)
- Ensure type-only vs value import separation does not introduce runtime cycles
acceptance_criteria:
- Existing Genes test corpus compiles (type-check)
- Runtime tests pass for representative programs
close_reason: TS full harness + JS baseline tests green

title: M3: Enums + pattern matching (runtime + TS union typing)
description:
Implement enum emission that preserves Haxe runtime semantics while producing ergonomic TS unions.

Include:
- genes.enum_discriminator support
- switch/case correctness
acceptance_criteria:
- Enum-heavy fixtures compile + run
- TS types are discriminated unions (or equivalent)
- Pattern matching behavior matches Haxe JS expectations
close_reason: Enums emit TS discriminated unions (function container + namespace), strict TS harness + runtime tests green.

title: M4: Interfaces/typedefs/abstracts/generics
description:
Finish the type-surface for TS: interfaces, typedefs, generics, and abstract mapping strategy.

Include:
- Interface type/value namespace merging as needed
- Type-only import generation
- Constraint mapping (T extends ...)
acceptance_criteria:
- Generic-heavy fixtures type-check
- Interface runtime expectations met (when runtime mode enabled)
- Type graph does not reference missing types
close_reason: Interfaces/typedefs/generics/constraints all type-check in TS mode; strict TS full harness (tsc --strict + runtime) green.

title: M5: Externs + JS/TS interop (jsRequire/native/selfCall)
description:
Support extern-driven interop patterns and ensure import shapes are correct.

Include:
- @:jsRequire default/named/namespace
- @:native dotted paths
- @:selfCall
- extern __init__ policy
acceptance_criteria:
- Interop fixtures compile and run
- Import shapes match expectations across profiles
close_reason: Extern/jsRequire/native/selfCall interop passes in TS strict full harness + existing interop fixtures (TestRequire/TestExtendExtern/TestReactComponent).

title: M6: DCE/type-graph correctness + packaging
description:
Solve the runtime-vs-type reachability problem and finalize distribution workflow.

Include:
- Dual graph (runtime + type) so TS signatures never reference missing exports
- Build pipeline: src-gen/ TS + dist/ JS+d.ts
- Minimal-runtime mode behavior and docs
acceptance_criteria:
- No missing-type references in TS output under -dce full
- Packaging build produces usable dist/
- Minimal-runtime profile documented and tested
close_reason: M6 complete: TS mode includes type-only deps under -dce full; added regression test. Added example build pipeline (tsc -> dist) and fixed script to run from repo root. Implemented -D genes.ts.minimal_runtime (skips / registration) with docs + minimal harness. Gates: npm test, npm run test:genes-ts:full, npm run test:genes-ts:minimal, npm run build:example:genes-ts.

title: M7: Debuggability (Haxe→TS maps + optional TS→JS composition)
description:
Improve debugging experience.

Include:
- Robust Haxe→TS sourcemaps
- Document chained maps vs composition
- If needed, implement map composition for Haxe→TS→JS
acceptance_criteria:
- Haxe→TS sourcemaps generated with -debug / -D js_source_map
- Sourcemap JSON uses correct "file" field (e.g. Main.ts)
- Test: npm run test:genes-ts:sourcemaps passes
- docs/typescript-target/DEBUGGING.md documents workflow + limitations
notes: Work paused to implement React HXX feature; DEBUGGING.md added but need to verify sourcemap usability end-to-end.

title: M8: Snapshot tests for generated TS output
description:
Add snapshot/golden tests for the emitted TypeScript to catch formatting/structural regressions that runtime tests might miss.

Scope ideas:
- Pick a small suite of fixtures (tests_ts/, tests_ts_full/, and/or curated haxe code)
- Emit TS into a temp dir
- Normalize output (stable formatting + newline)
- Compare against committed snapshots (per-module .ts files)
- Provide an update mode (e.g. UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1)
acceptance_criteria:
- npm run test:genes-ts and npm run test:genes-ts:minimal include snapshot checks
- Snapshots stored under tests_snapshots/ and are deterministic
- Update workflow: UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1 npm run test:genes-ts:snapshots
- Snapshot failures show readable git --no-index diffs

title: chore: migrate node harness scripts to TypeScript
description: Convert scripts/*.mjs to TypeScript with proper types, add a small build step (tsc) and keep all local/CI suites running via the same commands. This improves maintainability and matches the project preference for typed tooling.

title: todoapp: remove explicit any in generated TS (web/server/e2e)
description: Refactor todoapp Haxe code + externs (React/React Router/Express/Playwright) to avoid Dynamic/untyped so generated TS for todo modules has no explicit : any / <any> / as any. Keep TS strict passing.
